org.jcvi.jillion.sam.index

Class BamIndex

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jcvi.jillion.sam.index.BamIndex

  • public final class BamIndex
extends Object
    BamIndex is an object representation of an entire BAM index (.bai) file.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BamIndex(SamHeader header, List<ReferenceIndex> indexes)
      Convenience constructor with null total number of reads.
      BamIndex(SamHeader header, List<ReferenceIndex> indexes, Long totalNumberOfUnmappedReads)
      Create a new BamIndex instance that uses the given SamHeader, ordered list of ReferenceIndexes and optional total number of unmapped reads.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BamIndex

        public BamIndex(SamHeader header,
                List<ReferenceIndex> indexes)
        Convenience constructor with null total number of reads. This is the same as new BamIndex(header, indexes, null).
        Parameters:
        header - the SamHeader to use; can not be null. The order of the ReferenceSequences must match the order of the ReferenceIndex list.
        indexes - the List of ReferenceIndex to use; can not be null, but may be empty if no reads mapped.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if either header or indexes are null.
        See Also:
        BamIndex(SamHeader,List,Long)

      • BamIndex

        public BamIndex(SamHeader header,
                List<ReferenceIndex> indexes,
                Long totalNumberOfUnmappedReads)
        Create a new BamIndex instance that uses the given SamHeader, ordered list of ReferenceIndexes and optional total number of unmapped reads.
        Parameters:
        header - the SamHeader to use; can not be null. The order of the ReferenceSequences must match the order of the ReferenceIndex list.
        indexes - the List of ReferenceIndex to use; can not be null, but may be empty if no reads mapped.
        totalNumberOfUnmappedReads - optional total number of unmapped reads, only used for metadata collection, this value may be null if the value is unknown.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if either header or indexes are null.

    • Method Detail

      • createFromFiles

        public static BamIndex createFromFiles(File bam,
                                       File bai)
                                throws IOException
        Create a new BamIndex instance using the given sorted BAM file and corresponding BAM index file. The sort order is assumed to be in SortOrder.COORDINATE even if the header says otherwise. Only the header is parsed from the BAM file to get header information.
        Parameters:
        bam - the BAM file to parse; file must exist.
        bai - the BAM index file to parse; file must exist. It is assumed that the index corresponds to the the data in the BAM file.
        Returns:
        a new BamIndex instance; will never be null.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem parsing either file.

      • getReferenceIndex

        public ReferenceIndex getReferenceIndex(int i)
        Get the ReferenceIndex by the order given in the header.
        Parameters:
        i - the ith ReferenceIndex to get; must be 0 <=i < getNumberOfReferenceIndexes()
        Returns:
        the selected ReferenceIndex will never be null.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if i is not <0 or >= getNumberOfReferenceIndexes().

      • getReferenceIndexOffset

        public Integer getReferenceIndexOffset(String refName)
        Get the Integer offset for this Reference by its name as determined by ReferenceSequence#getName(). This return value can then be used in getReferenceIndex(int).
        Parameters:
        refName - the refName to get, can not be null;
        Returns:
        an Integer or null if there is no ReferenceIndex with that name.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if refName is null.

      • getNumberOfReferenceIndexes

        public int getNumberOfReferenceIndexes()
        Get the number of ReferenceIndexes in this bam index.
        Returns:
        an int >=0.

      • getReferenceIndex

        public ReferenceIndex getReferenceIndex(String refName)
        Get the ReferenceIndex by its name as determined by ReferenceSequence#getName().
        Parameters:
        refName - the refName to get, can not be null;
        Returns:
        a ReferenceIndex or null if there is no ReferenceIndex with that name.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if refName is null.

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Object

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object obj)
        Two BamIndexes are equal if they have the same ReferenceIndexes in the same order and the same names to the ReferenceIndex.
        Note: Since getTotalNumberOfUnmappedReads() is optional, it is not used in equality comparisons.
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object

      • getTotalNumberOfUnmappedReads

        public Long getTotalNumberOfUnmappedReads()
        Get the optionally provided total number of unmapped reads which some BamIndexes include as part of metadata.
        Returns:
        the number as a Long or null if the value is not available.
